              ],
              ["package.json", [["c"]]],

              [" will automatically read dependencies from the "],

              [

          "id": "60962242-14c2-4407-b967-d7237624f156",

                "npm install <name>@<version range>\n\n# e.g. to install a version which matches \"version >= 4.10.1\" and \"version < 4.11.1\"\n# of the package lodash\nnpm install lodash@\">=4.10.1 <4.11.1\""

            ]

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Some modules do not only provide a library for you to use, but they also provide one or more binaries which are intended to be used via the command line. Although you can still install those packages locally, it is often preferred to install them globally so the command-line tools can be enabled. In that case, "
              ],
              ["npm", [["c"]]],
              [
                " will automatically link the binaries to appropriate paths (e.g. "
              ],
              ["/usr/local/bin/<name>", [["c"]]],
              [
                ") so they can be used from the command line. To install a package globally, use:"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1552017868213,
          "id": "97e4b424-c76f-470f-a07a-c7395d31ea6e",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1552017868213,
          "parent_id": "60962242-14c2-4407-b967-d7237624f156",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "# packages distributed as a tarball\nnpm install <tarball file>\nnpm install <tarball url>\n\n# packages available locally\nnpm install <local path>\n\n# packages available as a git repository\nnpm install <git remote url>\n\n# packages available on GitHub\nnpm install <username>/<repository>\n\n# packages available as gist (need a package.json)\nnpm install gist:<gist-id>\n\n# packages from a specific repository\nnpm install --registry=http://myreg.mycompany.com <package name>\n\n# packages from a related group of packages \n# See npm scope\nnpm install @<scope>/<name>(@<version>)\n\n# Scoping is useful for separating private packages hosted on private registry from\n# public ones by setting registry for specific scope\nnpm config set @mycompany:registry http://myreg.mycompany.com\nnpm install @mycompany/<package name>"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["Note:", [["b"]]],
              [
                " If you run into permission issues while trying to install an npm module globally, resist the temptation to issue a "
              ],
              ["sudo npm install -g ...", [["c"]]],
              [
                " to overcome the issue. Granting third-party scripts to run on your system with elevated privileges is dangerous. The permission issue might mean that you have an issue with the way "
              ],
              ["npm", [["c"]]],
              [
                " itself was installed. If you’re interested in installing Node in sandboxed user environments, you might want to try using "
              ],
              ["nvm", [["a", "https://github.com/creationix/nvm"]]],
              ["."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

                "If you have build tools, or other development-only dependencies (e.g. Grunt), you might not want to have them bundled with the application you deploy. If that’s the case, you’ll want to have it as a development dependency, which is listed in the "
              ],
              ["package.json", [["c"]]],
              [" under "],
              ["devDependencies", [["c"]]],
              [". To install a package as a development-only dependency, use "],

              [" (or "],
              ["-D", [["c"]]],
              [")."]
